column4: You may want also: sudo smbpasswd -e name                     to enable that account after creating a password for it
You probably shouldn't be manually deleting anything in there. Remove obsolete kernels through the package manager and it will automatically clean that directory out
you can do that through the package manager? how?
If you see in boot for instance an old kernel version with a file like: vmlinuz-2.6.22-2-generic   then remove the package linux-image-2.6.22-2-generic, possibly also linux-headers-2.6.22-2-generic
